heading: Today
text: Cloudy, with snow developing this morning from the Adirondacks and southwest of I-89, spreading northeast this afternoon. Some rain possible late from Bennington south and west. Amounts 1 to 3 inches south, up to an inch north.  Highs in the 20s to near 30 northeast, and low to mid 30s southwest.  Light winds, becoming southeast up to 10 mph from the Green Mountains west.

heading: Tonight
text: Snow in the evening, and any rain southwest changing back to snow and tapering off, lingering northeast until morning.  Totals 2 to 5 inches, up to 8 in the mountains.  Lows in the 20s, near 20 far north.  Winds southeast 5 to 15 mph, shifting to the northwest late.

heading: Wednesday
text: Morning snow northeast tapering off.  Clouds breaking for periods of sun, mostly west and south.  Highs in the 20s north, 30s south, steady or falling during the afternoon.  Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph, decreasing through the afternoon.
